Articles.Content:
Just thought I'd drop in and introduce myself. Although I'm not completely new to the game with 12 days under my belt now I'm still a long way from creating my Eeloo Transfer Capable vehicle, or one to Minimus for that matter. But great feats in space weren't achieved in a single day, it took years for NASA to put a man on the Moon. In the mean time for those who are interested I started a blog as a fun way to remember my successes (and failures) and help other Kerbonauts through the experience I gain as I work my way up in my crazy little space program. I hope to chat with fellow Kerbonauts in the coming days and look forward to seeing what the community can accomplish in the awesome and amazing game!

-Culv3r
Welcome! Man, you really go into detail on your blog. My hat is off to you sir! I'd like to see some of your personal creations though. Keep it coming!

Welcome to the forums!

I'm quite impressed by the quality and detail in your writing. I'm something of an aspiring author myself, although I haven't really written much that I've put out in public. I'll be keeping tabs on it to see your progress; I'm always up for a good story.

If you get stuck on anything or are just looking for better ways to optimize your performance, I'd highly recommend the Drawing Board (link in my sig) as a good place to start. It has tutorials, delta-v maps, links to various sorts of calculators, and all sorts of other useful resources. You can also ask questions in the How To section of the forums, where a lot of the more knowledgeable players like to hang out and share their accumulated wisdom. Feel free to look around and hop into any conversation that interests you.

Happy landings!

@Xiphos - Thanks for the welcome and yeah, I'm slowly but surely going to find my balance between information and brevity. There's just so much detail to cover with this game that I didn't want to leave anything out and well, to keep it lively and not just preclude it solely to science, I also wanted to have it be something of a story to tell. I'll definitely be sharing my builds that I come up with and I look forward to sharing them and learning from others.

@Specialist - Thanks as well for the welcome. Thank you for the compliments and the advice. I'll do my best to keep my blog interesting that's for sure.
Welcome to the forums Culv3r!I like the detail in your Blog,most people just write a word or few,but you made a truly good introduction.Hope to see you on the Forums!
